column4: When I try to "activate" the NVIDIA proprietary driver, all I get is a dialog titled "Cannot change driver" that says "Reconfiguring X.org video drivers is not possible: /etc/X11/xorg.conf is invalid."
If xorg.conf is invalid, it's not my fault, I never touched it.
How do I get it to be valid?
try to get an older version of xorg. there are backups under /etc/X11/
I'm in X now, by the way.  I'm not sure if that was obvious already.
i can't believe. did u restart the Xserver after moving xorg.backup to xorg?
if u are in X all times it is not possible that u has X restarted
All times?  Not all times, but I'm in X now, and I was in X before.
ok thats right. There should be the original Xorg in /etc/X11/ it must be the oldest file. the xorg u got through the installation of Ubuntu
Okay, I'll try it.  But I tried a few already, including the .failsafe, all with the same results.
I guess you think I should read https://wiki.ubuntu.com/X/Config/Resolution ?
